original_title: Dialog sustains growth momentum, delivering strong 1H 2025 performance
original_body_lines: Dialog Axiata PLC announced its consolidated financial results for the six months ended 30th June 2025. Financial results included those of Dialog Axiata PLC (the “Company”) and of Dialog Axiata Group (the “Group”).

The Group delivered robust results across its Mobile, Fixed Line, Digital Pay Television, and Tele-infrastructure businesses, achieving 6% year-to-date (“YTD”) revenue growth to Rs87.4Bn in 1H 2025. This was despite the strategic scaling down of low-margin international wholesale business, amounting to approximately Rs10Bn. On a quarter-on-quarter (“QoQ”) basis, revenue increased 2% to Rs44.1Bn, driven primarily by data revenue expansion. Core revenue for the period reached Rs84.2Bn, up 21% YTD.

Group Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortisation (“EBITDA”) recorded a growth of 50% YTD to Rs40.5Bn in 1H 2025, with QoQ EBITDA rising 5% to Rs20.8Bn. The strong performance reflects both revenue growth and operational efficiencies. The EBITDA margin improved by 13.5 percentage points compared to 1H 2024, reaching 46.3%, surpassing pre-crisis margin.

Group Net Profit After Tax (“NPAT”) was recorded at Rs9.2Bn in 1H 2025, more than doubling YTD. QoQ NPAT grew by 23% to Rs5.1Bn, supported by improved EBITDA and lower finance costs. In line with improved operational performance, Operating Free Cash Flow (“OFCF”) improved by 78% YTD to Rs22.1Bn.

At the entity level, Dialog Axiata PLC (the “Company”) continued to account for a substantial share of Group performance, contributing 75% of Group Revenue and 73% of Group EBITDA. Company revenue reached Rs66.0Bn for 1H 2025 and Rs33.7Bn for Q2 2025, up 28% YTD and 5% QoQ respectively, driven by growth in Data and Voice segments. Profitability improved significantly, with Company EBITDA rising to Rs29.4Bn for 1H 2025 and Rs15.3Bn for Q2 2025, up 68% YTD and 8% QoQ. Supported by this EBITDA performance, Company NPAT was recorded at Rs6.9Bn for 1H 2025 and Rs4.0Bn for Q2 2025, reflecting strong growth over the corresponding periods.

Dialog Television (“DTV”) consolidated its leadership position in the Digital Pay Television market, maintaining a subscriber base of over 1.6Mn as of end 1H 2025. DTV revenue reached Rs6.4Bn for 1H 2025 and Rs3.3Bn for Q2 2025, up 5% YTD and 5% QoQ. Growth was supported by higher Subscription and Advertising revenues. DTV EBITDA grew 24% YTD to Rs1.2Bn for 1H 2025; however, NPAT was recorded at a negative Rs479Mn for the period.

Dialog Broadband Networks (“DBN”), encompassing the Group’s Fixed Telecommunications, Broadband, and International Businesses, posted revenue of Rs17.4Bn for 1H 2025 and Rs8.4Bn for Q2 2025, down 38% YTD and 8% QoQ. This decline was primarily due to the scaling down of low-margin international wholesale operations. Nevertheless, DBN EBITDA increased 20% YTD to Rs9.6Bn in 1H 2025, driven by growth in Broadband business. NPAT recorded a growth of 67% YTD to Rs2.8Bn.
